mean.gloss: the average value of a data set

median.gloss: the middle value of an ordered data set
median.exec: lambda values: sorted(values)[len(values)//2] if len(values)%2==1 else 0.5*(sorted(values)[len(values)//2-1] + sorted(values)[len(values)//2])

mode.gloss: the most frequently occurring value in a data set

range.gloss: the difference between the largest and smallest values

midrange.gloss: the average of the maximum and minimum values

variance_population.gloss: the average squared deviation from the population mean
variance_population.exec: lambda values: sum((x - (sum(values)/len(values)))**2 for x in values) / len(values)

standard_deviation_population.gloss: the square root of the population variance
standard_deviation_population.exec: lambda values: (sum((x - (sum(values)/len(values)))**2 for x in values) / len(values))**0.5

variance_sample.gloss: the average squared deviation from the sample mean using n - 1
variance_sample.exec: lambda values: sum((x - (sum(values)/len(values)))**2 for x in values) / (len(values) - 1)

standard_deviation_sample.gloss: the square root of the sample variance
standard_deviation_sample.exec: lambda values: (sum((x - (sum(values)/len(values)))**2 for x in values) / (len(values) - 1))**0.5

z_score.gloss: the number of standard deviations a value is from the mean
z_score.exec: lambda x, mean, sd: (x - mean) / sd

covariance.gloss: a measure of how two variables change together
covariance.exec: lambda xs, ys: sum((xs[i] - sum(xs)/len(xs))*(ys[i] - sum(ys)/len(ys)) for i in range(len(xs))) / len(xs)

correlation.gloss: a standardized measure of linear relationship between two variables
correlation.exec: lambda xs, ys: (sum((xs[i] - sum(xs)/len(xs))*(ys[i] - sum(ys)/len(ys)) for i in range(len(xs))) / len(xs)) / (((sum((x - (sum(xs)/len(xs)))**2 for x in xs) / len(xs))**0.5) * ((sum((y - (sum(ys)/len(ys)))**2 for y in ys) / len(ys))**0.5))

linear_regression_slope.gloss: the slope of the least squares regression line
linear_regression_slope.exec: lambda xs, ys: (sum((xs[i] - sum(xs)/len(xs))*(ys[i] - sum(ys)/len(ys)) for i in range(len(xs))) / len(xs)) / (sum((x - (sum(xs)/len(xs)))**2 for x in xs) / len(xs))

linear_regression_intercept.gloss: the intercept of the least squares regression line
linear_regression_intercept.exec: lambda xs, ys: (sum(ys)/len(ys)) - ((sum((xs[i] - sum(xs)/len(xs))*(ys[i] - sum(ys)/len(ys)) for i in range(len(xs))) / len(xs)) / (sum((x - (sum(xs)/len(xs)))**2 for x in xs) / len(xs))) * (sum(xs)/len(xs))

normal_pdf.gloss: the probability density function of the normal distribution
normal_pdf.exec: lambda math, x, mean, sd: (1/(sd*((2*math.pi)**0.5))) * math.exp(-((x-mean)**2)/(2*(sd**2)))

normal_cdf_approx.gloss: an approximation of the cumulative distribution function of the normal distribution
normal_cdf_approx.exec: lambda math, x, mean, sd: 0.5*(1 + math.erf((x-mean)/(sd*(2**0.5))))

binomial_probability.gloss: the probability of k successes in n independent trials

permutation.gloss: the number of ways to arrange k items from n distinct items
permutation.exec: lambda math, n, k: math.factorial(n) / math.factorial(n-k)

combination.gloss: the number of ways to choose k items from n distinct items
combination.exec: lambda math, n, k: math.comb(n, k)
